reviews.review:
Well where do I even start with this game...

So I own the PS4 version of the game since early 2018 having put a lot of hours there, more than I have on steam and that's for sure. Combined it's for sure 700+ hours, I have consistently hit high ranks so I believe I have a good understanding of the game, the meta etc. 

Dead by Daylight is a special game because of it's concept. It's an assymetrical horror game with fun killers with unique abilities, each match has 1 killer and a group of 4 survivors. Simple gameplay once you get the hang of it.

There are a lot of perks, each player can select up to 4 perks in their loadout. I say a lot because the number doesn't even matter, since everyone is using the same 5-6 perks every game. Why is that? Because the meta hasn't changed in years. The playstyles aren't unique because you are essentially forced to play with meta perks in order to have fun, since the rest of the perks for both killers and survivors are useless. In my opinion, I feel like the meta survivor perks are broken, the killer ones make the game a bit more bearable for them but every match in higher ranks is the killer being bullied by a group of 4 and being unable to play the objective, because a match usually lasts about 5-8 minutes maximum. This is the gen rushing meta.

Now, all this is happening for years, because the developers don't care about the playerbase that is dedicated to the game. Most players pick survivor and bring in most of the money from cosmetics so it makes sense for the developers to be a bit survivor sided. Most killer bugs aren't even taken care of in time and I usually stop playing the game for a very long time because I'm sick and tired of having to deal with the classic killer experience, which is depression. All the developers care about is making money and not fixing the game, they release dlcs upon dlcs, cosmetics and they don't care about fixing game breaking bugs. A few bugs I encountered have been scratch marks dissapearing instantly, having sound issues, getting blocked by invisible walls and picking up survivors doing generators only for the animation stopping mid way and me freezing for 3-5 seconds losing that precious time staring at my screen, looking at the killers frozen hand, unable to move or do anything.

The game also has huge balance issues. The developers make changes for the casual players, which are survivors for the most part. Why is this a problem? Well, for anyone that belongs in the dedicated playerbase and is good at the game, they can massively exploit stuff. This means they can exploit perks, the survivor hitboxes (since survivors can loop the killer indefinitely) etc. When a killer perk is found to be viable it gets nerfed to the ground instantly but the survivor meta hasn't changed since I started to play the game, thats 3 years ago. The developers also make changes that the community is against, such as the new HUD. Pallet hitboxes are still bad by the way.

Survive with friends is also another problem. It's almost impossible for a good killer to beat a good survive with friends group. When you can communicate past the 2 emotes and can literally talk and tell your friends who the killer is chasing, if he is bluffing, where he is going etc. it gives your team a huge advantage over the 1 player. Again, it's a 1v4 game and the power role is the group..? 

All this results in survivor queue times being very long, people don't want to play killer because the experience is bad. Both survivors and killers can be toxic. In my experience the survivors tend to be the most toxic in post-game chat.

I honestly can't recommend the game if you are in for the killer experience and this is the reason I'm giving Dead by Daylight a negative review. The game should be fun for both parties, not just one. If you want to play survivor with your friends it's fun though. The game overall is in the same bad state for years. It can be fun though sometimes  so only buy it when on sale, not the full price.

The tunneled becomes the tunneler!

Really fun to play as killer or a survivor with friends

I only played this game through the free weekends, I've decided to get it now because the game has grown so much in fun ways, that is: good new contents, cool collaborations and decent quality of life updates. Dead by Daylight is a solid stealth multiplayer game by its own right, this applies to killer gameplay too as it demands knowledge of stealth tactics to maneuvering.

Like most big multiplayer games, the community is largely consisted of humble teenagers whose strong belief is that if a match is won it is because of their own making, and if it's lost then it is the fault of others. But here is how it differ from other multiplayer games with toxic community: win and lose DOESN'T matter in Dead by Daylight. Each match is a fun and unique experience that will reward you however you played it. This game is toxic only when you apply the win and lose mindset to this game and turn it into a competitive race.

One thing I don't like about DBD is its diverse cosmetic system being hindered by a large paywall, it is understandable that developers need the cash for new contents, but I still wish players could get it easier with a gain-able currency.

Ich finde besonders gut, dass es immer eine gewisse abwechslung der Surviver und Killer hat, im gegensatzt zu anderen spielen von diesem Prinzip.

Das einzige wo man vielleicht ergÃ¤nzen kÃ¶nnte wÃ¤re mit Ki zu spielen, dass es auch mal offline geht oder

Dead by Daylight has become Dead or Alive.

This game used to be great but it just keeps getting worse and worse with each update. The most offensive part of it is the pricing model they use. Anyone who bought the resident evil DLC knows this. You paid $11 for the DLC then are asked to per $11-$15 per outfit for Claire, Chris etc. If you want all the content, you're gonna be paying over $50 to complete the DLC. When did Dead by Daylight become Dead or Alive? There's fun to be had but with the game but the pricing has gotten completely out of hand. If you're going to charge such exorbitant prices, at least make the game free to play. I can only imagine the disappoint of people who buy the base game in 2021, only to discover that how much content is behind a pay wall. Not just cosmetics but abilities that greatly increase your chances of success in the game. Pay to win? Yep, to an extent, that's what's going on here.

Hi I know my playtime may not be very convincing, but I have played this game A LOT on the ps4 (6 months now) and just got it on Steam. This is such a fun and unique game that is definetely worth a try! It feels so good when you beat someone who was teabagging you or camping because you know that your skill made you the better player. Anyway, just get the game. (Check out Otzdarva if you want any tips on who to lvl up first)

Es ist ein richtig heftiges Game, was sich zu 100% lohnt da man sehr viele Stunden SpaÃŸ haben kann, am besten halt noch mit Kollegen. Es gibt nur zwei Problem mit dem Spiel, das wÃ¤ren dann so zwei Killer die zu Op sind, und so gut wie nicht konter bar sind. Das wÃ¤ren zum beispiel "Spirit" und der neue Killer "Nemesis", die sind einfach zu stark und brauchen unbedingt einen Nerf. 

Das zweite Problem ist das man als Killer meistens sehr lange eine Lobby suchen muss, bei mir meistens um die 8-10min, was halt auch etwas nerven kann,

Trotzdem empfehle ich das Game jeden der "Horror, Coop und Nervenkitzel" mag. 

Falls jemanden meine Specs interessieren schreibe ich sie dazu!

Intel Core i5-7500
GeForce GTX 1060 6Gb OC
